intro: Cyrtandra sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in montane forests and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It features heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
